description: Erection of single storey rear extension (4.5m in depth, maximum height of 3m and eaves height of 3m)
decision_conditions: The total enlargement (being the enlarged part together with any existing enlargement of the original dwellinghouse to which it will be joined) would extend beyond a wall forming a side elevation of the original dwellinghouse, and would have a width greater than half the width of the original dwellinghouse, in conflict with Paragraphs A.1 (ja) and (j) (iii), of Class A, part 1, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

Notwithstanding the submitted information, it has not been demonstrated that all the materials used in any exterior work of the proposed development would be of a similar appearance to those used in the construction of the exterior of the existing dwellinghouse, in conflict with Condition A.3 (a) of Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

The applicant has failed to demonstrate through the submission of accurate drawings that the total enlargement would fall within the parameters of permitted development, contrary to A.4(2)(b), as set out under Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) as the existing side extension would fall outside the redline boundary for the site.
